oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Is a radical bridge a route to strong exchange interactions in lanthanide complexes? A computational examination
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAJESHKUMAR, T
RAJARAMAN, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SINGLE-MOLECULE MAGNET
HEXADENTATE SCHIFF-BASES
NITROXIDE FREE-RADICALS
GADOLINIUM(III) COMPLEXES
DINITROGEN REDUCTION
GD
MAGNETIZATION
CLUSTERS
DY
LN
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The origin of very strong antiferromagnetic exchange in N-2(3-) bridged complex, [{[(Me3Si)(2)N](2)Gd(THF)}(2)(mu-eta(2):eta(2)-N-2)](-) (1) has been probed using density functional theory (DFT) combined with molecular orbital (MO) and natural bond orbital (NBO) analysis. The analysis helps us to propose a generic mechanism of coupling for a {2p-4f} class of compounds.
